title: Make the frontend fully responsive across mobile, tablet (iPad), and desktop

requirements.text: Ensure the entire frontend layout is responsive and usable across common breakpoints (mobile, tablet/iPad, laptop/desktop), with no horizontal scrolling or clipped content on any page (Home, About, Menu, Offers, Contact, and Menu Management).

quotes: make is feasible to all devices like mobile,ipad,laptop

acceptanceCriteria: At viewport widths ~360px (mobile), ~768px (tablet), and ~1280px (desktop), every route renders without horizontal scrolling.
No text, buttons, cards, images, or dialogs overflow their containers; content reflows appropriately.
Tap targets on mobile (buttons/links) are not cramped and remain accessible without accidental taps.

requirements.text: Adjust the header navigation and header contents to be responsive at mobile/tablet/desktop sizes, including appropriate spacing, wrapping behavior, and avoidance of overflow for the brand name, search bar, and nav actions.

quotes: make is feasible to all devices like mobile,ipad,laptop

acceptanceCriteria: On mobile, the hamburger menu and mobile nav render without overflow; opening the menu shows all links and the search input fully within the viewport.
On tablet sizes, the header does not feel cramped: spacing is balanced and elements do not overlap; the search and nav are displayed using appropriate breakpoints.
On desktop, the existing layout (logo + search + nav + social) remains aligned, with consistent vertical centering and no layout shift when navigating between pages.

requirements.text: Make key page grids/sections responsive, especially the Home page hero, cuisine card grid, and any multi-column sections, so that typography scales and layout transitions cleanly from single-column (mobile) to multi-column (tablet/desktop).

quotes: make is feasible to all devices like mobile,ipad,laptop

acceptanceCriteria: Home page hero content (logo, heading, subtitle, CTA buttons) fits on mobile screens without clipping and with readable line-lengths.
Cuisine cards display as 1 column on small screens, 2 columns on small/medium screens where appropriate, and 3â€“4 columns on larger screens (no awkward partial columns or overflow).
Images keep correct aspect ratios and do not stretch; they remain within their cards/containers at all breakpoints.

requirements.text: Make the Menu Management page responsive, including the tab list, forms, and action buttons, so it remains usable on mobile and tablet (no tabs or form inputs extending off-screen).

quotes: make is feasible to all devices like mobile,ipad,laptop

acceptanceCriteria: TabsList remains usable on narrow screens (wraps cleanly or becomes horizontally scrollable without breaking layout).
Form grids (category fields and item fields) stack into a single column on mobile and become multi-column on larger viewports.
Primary actions (Save Changes / Reset / Logout) remain visible and usable on mobile without forcing sideways scrolling.

requirements.text: Verify and refine footer responsiveness so its grid collapses appropriately on smaller devices and maintains readable spacing and alignment for contact and social sections.

quotes: make is feasible to all devices like mobile,ipad,laptop

acceptanceCriteria: Footer sections render as a single-column stack on mobile, two columns on medium screens, and up to four columns on large screens, without overlap.
Contact rows (address/phone/hours) wrap neatly without icon/text collision.
Footer links and buttons remain readable and do not overflow their containers.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn UI components are read-only).
Do not edit immutable hook files: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.

Backend changes are not required for responsiveness; keep the Motoko canister logic unchanged unless a blocking UI issue is found. (If state/schema changes are needed, add a migration only under the conditional migration policy.)
nonGoals: Adding new pages or new business features unrelated to responsive layout.
Changing authentication behavior (Internet Identity) or backend access control.
Implementing real-time features or external integrations.
